New Records: West Indies won the match by 5 wickets with 6 balls remaining.
Roston Chase scored an unbeaten 42 off 27 balls.
Key Match Events: West Indies were five down needing 40 off 24 balls in the chase.
Roston Chase's 42* helped West Indies secure the victory.
Papua New Guinea almost took the game to the last over.
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies won the toss and chose to bat first.
Akeal Hosein opened the bowling and conceded only a single in the first over.
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies avoided an upset despite initial struggles.
Papua New Guinea showed spirit but fell short.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sese Bau scored 50 off 43 balls for Papua New Guinea.
Others: The match was played in Providence, Guyana.
The result was crucial for West Indies' campaign.
